intro: Hieracium macelophyllum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are basal, rough, and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with purple-tinted rays. Hieracium macelophyllum is often found in open habitats and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
